result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew C. Hinkle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Hit and Run [Modifiers: Penalty-Hit and Run], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/ surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Get and maintain full-time employment or full-time education.

Counseling per Agent.
Restitution TBD at hearing.
Credit TBD at next hearing.
Pay court costs and supervision fees.

The balance due shall be a condition of extended supervision/parole.  If discharged with financial obligations owing, a civil judgment shall be entered and/or other collection procedures will be implemented.

Restitution TBD at hearing.
Credit TBD at next hearing.
AMENDED 9-15-2016:  Sentence credit determined for a total of 380 days.
State law REQUIRES a DNA sample be provided for every criminal offense committed after April 1, 2015.
Pay court costs and supervision fees.
AMENDED 9-15-2016:  Restitution determined in the amount of $10,479.06.
